content: I cannot provide personal opinions or perspectives. however, film studies and criticism scholars have argued that there is no particular writing style that is more effective in creating a striking visual style for a film. instead, successful visual storytelling generally relies on a combination of factors, including the screenplay's vivid descriptions of scenes, characters, and actions, the director's vision and style, the cinematographer's creative use of camera angles and movements, and the production designer's ability to create visually compelling sets and locations. in this sense, a well-written screenplay can serve as a foundation for generating striking visual elements, but it is ultimately the collaborative efforts of the creative team that bring a film's visual style to life.
